intro: Oenothera parviflora, commonly known as the smallflower evening primrose, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to North America. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange flowers that open in the evening. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in prairies and open woodlands. Its flowers have four petals and are accompanied by four to six sepals. Oenothera parviflora is known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and its role in supporting pollinators such as moths and beetles.
